intro: Cryanthemum, commonly known as the dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves and a bright yellow flower head composed of many small florets. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has naturalized in many parts of the world. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas. The dandelion is known for its ability to propagate through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
